alert.note: Alert for Hart (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 21 at 1:47AM EDT until July 21 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following county, Hart. * WHEN...Until 400 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1247 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Munfordville, Horse Cave, Rowletts, Woodsonville, Logsdon Valley, Leitchfield Crossing, Mount Beulah, Kessinger, Forestville and Northtown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
